summary: A malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor (MPNST) is a rare and aggressive form of cancer that arises from the connective tissue surrounding peripheral nerves. It is classified as a sarcoma and can occur anywhere in the body where peripheral nerves are present. MPNSTs can be life-threatening, especially if they grow large or metastasize.
causes: Loss of heterozygosity on the 17p chromosome
Mutation of the p53 tumor suppressor gene
symptoms: Difficulty in moving the extremity with the tumor
Soreness localized to the area of the tumor or extremity
Pain or discomfort (numbness, burning, pins and needles)
Loss of hearing on one side
Numbness or paralysis of the face
subtypes: Malignant triton tumors (MPNST with rhabdomyoblastomatous component)
